About Me

I am a hard working individual who is always ready to learn. What motivates me the most is my curiosity. This allows me to grasp concepts very easily, especially when it comes to technology. I am thrilled to use my technical and marketing background to help a company excel. With great skills in software development, troubleshooting & debugging, I thrive in collaborative settings the most. I am currently most interested in learning more about the art of Human-Computer Interaction and Artificial Intelligence (including CV and natural language processing).

On my down time I like riding my bike, flying drones, driving my car and trying new foods.

Software

Aside from being highly skilled in object-oriented languages such as C++, Python, nodejs, I am also proficient in various Linux (i.e. Debian, Ubuntu, Jessie, CentOS), Bash shell & familiar with development on single-board computers such as the Raspberry Pi and ASUS Tinkerboard family lines. Additionally, I am very comfortable with installing computer hardware such as HDDs, SSDs, RAM & peripherals.

I love working with Linux.

Graphic Design

I have a keen eye for aesthetics, a creative mind and years of professional graphic design experience below my belt. I have developed, conceptualized, and implemented creative solutions and then lead a team that met marketing strategies for 4 years with UC Riverside.

My Experience

ViaTouch Media

Software Engineer

San Diego, CA

I work directly under the Director of Engineering and Director of Software to assist with the analysis, design, development, testing and documentation of new and existing software solutions. This includes developing new software, making improvements on existing software, and configuring software development tools as required by the company.

Accelerated Retail Technologies

Software Development Engineering Intern

Corona, CA

My team and I implemented & deployed major front-end software patch for ~3,800 RugDoctor Walmart kiosks running Windows. This update allowed for download of dynamic data from RugDoctor’s SOAP web services. Support for insertion of text, prices, images & videos of products on front interface.

Additionally, I rebuilt a front-end single page GUI app (HTML5) & JavaScript (AngularJS/Node.js) libraries to work with the modern automated retail machine, VICKI (getvicki.com).

Also interfaced with Natural Language Recognition services by piping audio to various cloud-based REST APIs using Node.js and Python to create an intelligent bandwith-friendly assistant who can answer a variety of questions about retail products (i.e. caffeine content, calories).

Worked with local SQL databases on kiosks to store & retrieve data required for transactions, products, pricing, etc.

Lastly, developed & reviewed User Acceptance Tests and executed regression tests relating to them.

University of California, Riverside

Media Development Supervisor

Riverside, CA

I was responsible for conceptualization and implementation of creative solutions that meet UCR Recreation department marketing strategies. This involved overseeing projects from concept to completion in either design, videography, social media, or engagement.

I played a lead role in performance evaluation assessments, organizing training sessions and the selection process of prospective employees.

Additionally, I continued performing my duties as a graphic designer.

University of California, Riverside

Graphic Designer

Riverside, CA

I planned and executed graphic design projects in a timely manner in order to market the services the UCR Recreation department offers to UCR students. This includes but is not limited to generating graphic media and the management of social media campaigns.

This position also required me to present the services the Recreation department offers to international students, members of the community and prospective students alike.

University of California, Riverside

B.S. Computer Science with Business Applications

Riverside, CA

The Computer Science with Business Applications degree covers the core of Computer Science along with basic business and management topics. This degree prepares students for careers in management of computer and information systems, system administration, and e-commerce. This major is a perfect fit for individuals looking for a technical degree with a business edge, such as for entrepenuers considering starting a high-tech company.
